Description: Neck and body sherd with handle root (mended from six fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat (black-figured) pottery krater; interior: black band at top of sherd; exterior: cream slip; upper frieze: part of a sphinx with raised paw to right, goose, lion with raised paw attacking a wild goat to its right; lower frieze: goats grazing to left; on lower wall, lotus flower and bud chain; dividing bands with added white and red stripes; filling ornaments: dotted rosettes, dotted circles, rosettes with scant incision; red patches on animals and on rosettes; incision used for details of animals and of filling ornaments on upper frieze; handle area at top glazed; trave of panel to right; red band lined in white below..
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.514)
